Line 113: Line 113:
==Volume bug==
==Volume bug==
â
A few days after the UK release, some users started noticing a glitch in the volume control, where the phone would lower the volume by itself,<ref name=Zbug>{{cite web|last=Woods|first=Ben|title=Samsung stays silent over Galaxy Nexus volume glitch|url=http://www.zdnet.co.uk/blogs/tech-tech-boom-10017860/samsung-stays-silent-over-galaxy-nexus-volume-glitch-10024853/|work=11-22-2011|publisher=Zdnet|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref><ref name=WPbug>{{cite news|last=Tsukayama|first=Hayley|title=Galaxy Nexus hit with volume bug in Britain|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/technology/galaxy-nexus-hit-with-volume-bug-in-britain/2011/11/21/gIQAuLG2hN_story.html?tid=pm_business_pop|accessdate=22 November 2011|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=11-22-2011}}</ref> [[Cnet|Cnet UK]] also reported that the phone in their review "dropped the volume when we were using 2G. This means it was almost impossible to make calls over 2G. We missed calls and texts due to not hearing alerts."<ref name=Cnetreview>{{cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus review|url=http://reviews.cnet.co.uk/mobile-phones/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review-50005755/|publisher=Cnet (UK)|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>. The issue was acknowledged by [[O2]] who noted that they were unable to offer a solution at the moment, but confirmed that both Google and Samsung are aware of the issue<ref name=DSbug>{{cite web|last=Laughlin|first=Andrew|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus users report crippling volume bug|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tech/news/a352228/samsung-galaxy-nexus-users-report-crippling-volume-bug.html|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref> On the 22 November 2011, the UK retailer [[Handtec]] temporarily stopped Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming that there was a problem with its stock of devices. The company noted that "the tests are showing when in 2G mode the volume is acting erratically".<ref>http://www.handtec.co.uk/blog/2011/11/samsung-galaxy-nexus-shipping-update/</ref><ref name=Vergebug>{{cite web|last=Ziegler|first=Chris|title=Retailer Handtec stops Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming volume bug|url=http://www.theverge.com/2011/11/22/2580432/retailer-handtec-stops-galaxy-nexus-shipments-after-confirming-volume|work=11-22-2011|publisher=The Verge|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>
+
A few days after the UK release, some users started noticing a glitch with the volume rocker, where the phone would lower the volume seemingly at random.<ref>http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=22021</ref><ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/21/european-galaxy-nexus-owners-complain-of-erratic-volume-issue-v/</ref>
  +
On the 22 November 2011, the UK retailer [[Handtec]] temporarily stopped Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming that there was a problem with its stock of devices.<ref>http://www.handtec.co.uk/blog/2011/11/samsung-galaxy-nexus-shipping-update/</ref><ref name=Vergebug>{{cite web|last=Ziegler|first=Chris|title=Retailer Handtec stops Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming volume bug|url=http://www.theverge.com/2011/11/22/2580432/retailer-handtec-stops-galaxy-nexus-shipments-after-confirming-volume|work=11-22-2011|publisher=The Verge|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>
  +
Soon after, both Google and Samsung confirmed the issue, saying they already had a fix and phones would be updated "as soon as possible"<ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/23/google-responds-to-galaxy-nexus-volume-complaints-says-fix-is-i/</ref><ref>http://www.androidpolice.com/2011/11/23/google-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-is-not-hardware-related-software-fix-already-on-the-way/</ref><ref>http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9222128/Samsung_to_issue_fix_for_Galaxy_Nexus_volume_issue</ref><ref>http://news.cnet.com/8301-1035_3-57330247-94/google-acknowledges-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-in-u.k/</ref><ref>http://www.zdnet.co.uk/blogs/tech-tech-boom-10017860/google-speaks-up-over-galaxy-nexus-volume-bug-10024859/</ref><ref>http://www.pcworld.com/article/244695/samsung_has_developed_a_fix_for_galaxy_nexus_sound_volume_issue.html</ref><ref>http://www.slashgear.com/samsung-confirms-nexus-volume-fix-but-freezes-shipments-23197598/</ref><ref>https://twitter.com/#!/samsunguk/status/139355492504973312</ref>
